results.title: Olives don't float
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, Don Anderson and Edwin Moses
results.brief_description: Peter Cummins plays an experienced seafarer who surveys the people and boats in the bay and points out the good and bad safety features of the various craft, their pilots and passengers. Production Manager: Penny Chapman. Cast includes: Frank Banset, Ray Sangston, Nino Ceron, Peter Eldridge, Jan Kuplis, Christine Ellison, Peter McKinley, Sven Kuplis, Julian Harvey, Peter Lewis.

results.title: Oliver Twist. Part 2
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Terrance Dicks and Gareth Davies
results.brief_description: Mrs Maylie and her adopted daughter, Rose, take pity on Oliver and nurse him back to health. Fagin and Monks plot to seize Oliver once again but Nancy reveals that Rose is the young sister of Oliver’s mother. The wicked Monks is packed off abroad with his half of the family legacy. Oliver is adopted by Mr Brownlow, and they settle down to live in the same neighbourhood as the Maylies.

results.title: Oliver Twist. Part 1
results.brief_description: A girl dies in childbirth in a country workhouse. Bumble, the parish beadle, christens the baby Oliver Twist. Oliver spends his childhood in the workhouse and eventually runs away to London where he mixes with a gang of young thieves. He is arrested on his first thieving expedition. Oliver is soon snatched back again by the evil Fagin, who attempts to force him into a life of crime with a criminal called Monks. On an abortive housebreaking attempt, Oliver is shot and left for dead.

results.title: Oliver Twist by Charles Dickens [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Cineguild, Anthony Havelock-Allan, Ronald Neame and David Lean
results.brief_description: The sequences of Oliver (John Howard Davies) arriving in London, meeting the Artful Dodger, his introduction to Fagin (Alec Guiness) and Fagin’s lessons in pickpocketing. Oliver’s first practical experience of it, and the chase through London streets. Cast includes Robert Newton, Kay Walsh and Francis L. Sullivan. Excerpt from the film “Oliver Twist” directed by David Lean.

results.title: Oliver Twist
results.brief_description: The two part BBC adaptation of the classic Dickens’ novel which stars Scott Funnell as Little Oliver, Ben Rodska as Oliver Twist, David Garlick as the Artful Dodger, and Eric Porter as Fagin. The orphaned Oliver runs away from the workhouse to London, where he takes up with a gang of pickpockets and thieves. Oliver is badly injured in an attempted burglary but is taken in by a kindly family and nursed back to health. But even then Oliver’s troubles are far from over.

results.title: Oliver Twist
results.creator_credit: Burbank Films, George Stephenson and Richard Slapczynski
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the Charles Dickens novel, aimed at younger viewers. Children can learn of the adventures of Oliver as he encounters Fagin, the Artful Dodger, Sykes and other memorable characters. Music composed and conducted by Richard Bowden. Voices include; Barbara Frawley, Robin Stewart and Wallas Eaton.

results.title: Oliver [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Warwick, Romulus Films, John Wolf and Carol Reed
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all family pictures, “Oliver” is a joyous and entertaining version of Dickens’ “Oliver Twist”. Mark Lester plays Oliver, the foundling who escapes the indignities of the workhouse to find success and happiness in the London underworld. Oliver’s new friends include the Artful Dodger and Fagin who teach him to “pick a pocket”. Star roles are played by Harry Secombe, Oliver Reed and Shani Wallis.

results.title: Oliver & company
results.brief_description: An animal variation on the loved story of ‘Oliver’, this version is set in New York and finds Oliver, an orphaned kitten, playing with the likes of pickpocket pooches such as Dodger and Tito, both of whom are controlled by the human, Fagin. Oliver is pitted against Fagin’s evil boss and his killer Dobermans when Jenny, the lonely little rich girl who adopts Oliver after he finds his way into her limousine, is kidnapped. It’s up to Oliver and his friends to stage a daring rescue mission through the city’s subway system. Features music by Billy Joel, Bette Midler and Huey Lewis.

results.title: Olive Oyl's army
results.brief_description: Join Private Olive Oyl and her friend Alice as they go into training at Fort Dragg in eight adventure-filled animated cartoons. See our hero Corporal Popeye face all manner of challenges to win the heart of his dear Olive while Sergeant Bluto goes out of his way to make life difficult for one and all at the camp. And of course where there’s Swee’pea, there’s bound to be trouble particularly when Swee’pea takes a fancy to parachuting. Something for everyone to enjoy. Executive producers: William Hanna and Joseph Barbera.
